short_summary: 24/7 dissemination of Health Canada-issued risk communication documents
description: The contract is for 24/7 delivery of Health Canada-issued risk communications related to a health product to a targeted audience list of health professionals and to hospitals via fax-out or email.
full_summary:
Title of Tender
================

**English:** 24/7 Dissemination of Health Canada-Issued Risk Communication Documents
**French:** Diffusion 24 heures sur 24, 7 jours sur 7, de documents de communication des risques émis par Santé Canada

**Contract Number:** 1000249262
**Reference Number:** cb-8811-39726680

**Closing Date and Time:** 2023-09-22 14:00:00

**Contract Duration:** October 1, 2023, to September 30, 2025

**Scope of Work:**

Health Canada is seeking the services of a professional company to provide 24/7 dissemination of Health Canada-issued risk communication documents for health products targeted to healthcare professionals and healthcare institutions. 

**Key Requirements:**

1. Ensure comprehensive databases of healthcare professionals and institutions are maintained.
2. Provide expert advice on audience selection, communication channel selection, and program optimization.
3. Offer fax broadcast service for health product risk communications (HPRCs).
4. Provide verification and report of successful fax transmissions (pay per basis).
5. Adapt format and template of risk communication documents as per Health Canada specifications.
6. Notify Health Canada when the fax broadcast is complete.

**Contractor Requirements:**

To be considered, the contractor must have 10 years of experience providing national fax broadcast services to health professionals and hospitals. A minimum of 24 hours delivery is expected, with the possibility of urgent risk communication within 5 hours.

**Contract Award Procedure:**

An Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) allows Health Canada to post a notice for no less than 15 calendar days, indicating to the supplier community that a contract will be awarded to a pre-identified contractor. If no other supplier submits a Statement of Capabilities within the closing time, the Contracting Authority may proceed to award a contract to the pre-identified contractor.
